instructions.name: authorize_claim
docs: Authorize a claim using Ed25519 stealth signature verification.
The caller must prepend an Ed25519Program instruction that verifies
a signature from the stealth address (beneficiary_commitment) over
the message: hash(position_id, nullifier, withdrawal_destination).
This creates a ClaimAuthorization PDA and a NullifierRecord PDA.
The NullifierRecord uses init constraint for double-claim prevention.

instructions.name: authorize_claim_compressed
docs: Authorize a claim from a compressed vesting position.
Similar to authorize_claim but works with Light Protocol compressed accounts.
The compressed position data is read via Light Protocol CPI (validity proof verification).
An Ed25519 signature from the stealth keypair authorizes the claim.
This creates a ClaimAuthorization PDA that the withdraw_compressed() can reference.

instructions.name: create_compressed_stealth_vesting_position
docs: Create a compressed vesting position with stealth address beneficiary.
Combines Light Protocol's 5000x cost reduction with stealth address privacy.
The stealth address is derived off-chain by the employer using employee's (S, V).
Emits both CompressedPositionCreated and StealthPaymentEvent for indexing/scanning.

accounts.name: fee_payer
docs: Fee payer for the Light Protocol CPI transaction

accounts.name: admin
docs: Organization admin who can create positions

accounts.name: organization
docs: Organization account (mutable for counter update)

accounts.name: schedule
docs: Vesting schedule for this position

accounts.name: system_program
docs: System program for account creation

instructions.name: create_compressed_vesting_position
docs: Create a compressed vesting position using Light Protocol.
This stores the position in a Merkle tree for 5000x cost reduction.
The position data is hashed and stored in Light Protocol's state tree,
while encrypted amounts are stored for Arcium MPC processing.
# Arguments
* `proof_bytes` - Serialized validity proof for Light Protocol state transition
* `address_tree_info_bytes` - Serialized address tree info for derivation
* `output_tree_index` - Index of the output state tree
* `beneficiary_commitment` - Hash commitment of beneficiary identity
* `encrypted_total_amount` - Arcium-encrypted total vesting amount
* `nonce` - Nonce for Arcium encryption
Note: This instruction requires Light Protocol accounts in remaining_accounts:
- light_system_program
- account_compression_program
- registered_program_pda
- noop_program
- cpi_authority_pda
- state_merkle_tree
- address_merkle_tree
- address_queue

accounts.name: fee_payer
docs: Fee payer for the Light Protocol CPI transaction

accounts.name: admin
docs: Organization admin who can create positions

accounts.name: organization
docs: Organization account (mutable for counter update)

accounts.name: schedule
docs: Vesting schedule for this position

accounts.name: system_program
docs: System program for account creation

instructions.name: create_stealth_vesting_position
docs: Create a vesting position with stealth address beneficiary.
The stealth address is derived off-chain by the employer:
1. Employer fetches employee's (S, V) from StealthMetaAddress
2. Generates ephemeral keypair (r, R = r*G)
3. Computes stealth_address = S + H(r * V) * G
This instruction stores the position and emits StealthPaymentEvent
so the employee can scan and discover the payment.

instructions.name: deactivate_stealth_meta
docs: Deactivate stealth meta-address.
Employee can deactivate to stop receiving stealth payments.

instructions.name: deposit_to_vault
docs: Deposit tokens into the organization vault.
The depositor transfers SPL tokens from their token account to the vault.

instructions.name: init_fetch_meta_keys_comp_def
docs: Initialize MPC computation definition for fetch_meta_keys

instructions.name: init_store_meta_keys_comp_def
docs: Initialize MPC computation definition for store_meta_keys

instructions.name: initialize_vault
docs: Initialize the token vault for an organization.
Creates a token account owned by a vault_authority PDA.
The organization admin can then deposit tokens to this vault.

instructions.name: process_claim_v2_callback
docs: Callback from the process_claim_v2 MPC computation.
Verifies the MPC output and updates:
- position.encrypted_claimed_amount from output ciphertexts[0]
- claim_authorization.is_processed = true

instructions.name: queue_process_claim
docs: Queue the process_claim_v2 MPC computation with integrated vesting calculation.
Computes vesting_numerator on-chain from Clock + schedule parameters.
Submits encrypted (total_amount, claimed_amount, vesting_numerator, claim_amount) to MPC.
The MPC circuit internally computes: claimable = (total * numerator / PRECISION) - claimed
Then validates: claim_amount <= claimable.
Callback updates position.encrypted_claimed_amount and sets is_processed=true.

instructions.name: queue_process_claim_compressed
docs: Queue MPC computation for a compressed position claim.
Computes vesting_numerator on-chain from Clock + schedule parameters.

accounts.name: position
docs: Scratch position account used as a callback target.
For compressed positions, the callback writes encrypted_claimed_amount here
(the real state lives in Light Protocol and is updated via update_compressed_position_claimed).

instructions.name: read_meta_keys_from_vault
docs: Read meta-keys from MPC vault.
MPC re-encrypts stored keys specifically for the requesting user.

instructions.name: register_stealth_meta
docs: Register stealth meta-address (S, V) for an employee.
Employees call this to publish their public stealth keys.
Employers fetch these to derive one-time stealth addresses for payments.

instructions.name: store_verification_key
docs: Store a verification key on-chain for a specific Noir circuit.
Only the designated authority (DAO admin) can store VKs.
The VK is derived from the circuit's trusted setup and contains
the parameters needed for Groth16 proof verification.
Each circuit type (withdrawal_proof, identity_proof, eligibility)
has a unique circuit_id derived as sha256(circuit_name).
# Arguments
* `circuit_id` - 32-byte identifier for the circuit
* `vk_data` - Serialized VerificationKey bytes

instructions.name: update_compressed_position_claimed
docs: Update the encrypted_claimed_amount on a compressed vesting position.
Called after process_claim_v2_compressed_callback() confirms the claim is valid.
This updates the Light Protocol Merkle tree with the new claimed amount.
Can only be called when the associated ClaimAuthorization is_processed=true
and is_withdrawn=false (prevents unauthorized updates).

instructions.name: update_stealth_meta
docs: Update stealth meta-address keys.
Allows employee to rotate their stealth keys.

instructions.name: update_verification_key
docs: Update a verification key (e.g., after a new trusted setup).
Only the original authority can update. This allows key rotation
without changing the circuit_id PDA.

instructions.name: verify_eligibility_proof
docs: Verify an eligibility proof on-chain.
The eligibility proof demonstrates:
- The prover is the designated beneficiary of a position
- The nullifier has not been used (prevents double-claim)
- The prover knows the opening to the position commitment
This is the primary proof used in the claim-withdraw flow,
replacing or augmenting the Ed25519 signature verification.

accounts.name: vk_account
docs: The verification key account for the eligibility circuit

accounts.name: proof_record
docs: Proof record PDA keyed by nullifier (prevents double-verification)

instructions.name: verify_identity_proof
docs: Verify an identity proof on-chain.
The identity proof demonstrates knowledge of the secret behind
a position commitment, without revealing the secret itself.
This is used to prove ownership of a vesting position.
Creates a ProofRecord keyed by position_commitment as the nullifier.

accounts.name: vk_account
docs: The verification key account for the identity circuit

accounts.name: proof_record
docs: Proof record PDA keyed by position_commitment (used as nullifier for identity proofs)

instructions.name: verify_withdrawal_proof
docs: Verify a withdrawal proof on-chain.
Performs Groth16 verification using the stored VK for the withdrawal circuit.
On success, creates a ProofRecord PDA that other instructions can reference.
The withdrawal proof demonstrates:
- Knowledge of a valid vesting position in the state tree
- The position is in the correct epoch
- The nullifier has not been used before
- The prover is entitled to the withdrawal
Requires ~1,400,000 compute units (pairing is expensive).

accounts.name: vk_account
docs: The verification key account for the withdrawal circuit

accounts.name: proof_record
docs: Proof record PDA - proves this verification happened on-chain.
Keyed by verifier + nullifier to prevent duplicate records.

instructions.name: withdraw
docs: Withdraw tokens from the organization vault to the beneficiary's destination.
Verifies the claim has been authorized, processed by MPC, and not yet withdrawn.
Transfers claim_amount tokens from vault to destination.

instructions.name: withdraw_compressed
docs: Withdraw tokens from the organization vault for a compressed position claim.
Similar to withdraw() but uses ClaimAuthorization derived from compressed position seeds
(organization + position_id + nullifier) instead of regular position account key.

instructions.name: write_meta_keys_to_vault
docs: Store meta-keys in MPC vault.
Employee's private keys are encrypted via Arcium MPC.
Only the MPC cluster can decrypt; re-encrypts specifically for user on read.

errors.name: InvalidPositionOrganization
errors.msg: Position does not belong to this organization

errors.name: InvalidAddressTree
errors.msg: Invalid address tree for Light Protocol

errors.name: ClaimNotProcessed
errors.msg: Claim has not been processed by MPC

errors.name: SignerMismatch
errors.msg: Signer does not match beneficiary commitment

errors.name: InvalidPublicInputCount
errors.msg: Invalid number of public inputs for this circuit

errors.name: ProofRecordAlreadyExists
errors.msg: Proof record already exists for this nullifier

types.name: CalculateVestedOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: ClaimAuthorization
docs: Authorization record for a claim against a vesting position.
Created by authorize_claim after Ed25519 signature verification.
Seeds: [b"claim_auth", position.key(), nullifier]

fields.name: position
docs: The vesting position being claimed against

fields.name: nullifier
docs: Nullifier to prevent double-claims (derived from identity_secret + position_id)

fields.name: withdrawal_destination
docs: Destination token account for withdrawal

fields.name: claim_amount
docs: Amount to claim (set during queue_process_claim)

fields.name: is_authorized
docs: Whether the Ed25519 signature was verified

fields.name: is_processed
docs: Whether MPC processing is complete

fields.name: is_withdrawn
docs: Whether tokens have been withdrawn

fields.name: authorized_at
docs: Timestamp of authorization

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: ClockAccount
docs: An account storing the current network epoch

fields.name: address
docs: Light Protocol derived address for this compressed account

types.name: ComputationDefinitionAccount
docs: An account representing a [ComputationDefinition] in a MXE.

types.name: ComputationDefinitionMeta
docs: A computation definition for execution in a MXE.

types.name: ComputationSignature
docs: The signature of a computation defined in a [ComputationDefinition].

types.name: EligibilityPublicInputs
docs: Public inputs for the eligibility proof circuit.
Circuit proves: "I am the beneficiary of this position and have not claimed yet."

fields.name: beneficiary_commitment
docs: Hash commitment of the beneficiary's identity

fields.name: nullifier
docs: Nullifier for this specific claim (prevents double-spend)

fields.name: position_id
docs: Identifier for the vesting position being claimed

fields.name: position_commitment
docs: Commitment binding to a specific position state

types.name: Epoch
docs: The network epoch

types.name: FetchMetaKeysOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: Groth16Proof
docs: Groth16 proof consisting of three curve points (A, B, C).
Generated by the Noir circuit prover (Barretenberg backend).

fields.name: a
docs: Proof point A on G1 (64 bytes uncompressed)

fields.name: b
docs: Proof point B on G2 (128 bytes uncompressed)

fields.name: c
docs: Proof point C on G1 (64 bytes uncompressed)

types.name: IdentityPublicInputs
docs: Public inputs for the identity proof circuit.
Circuit proves: "I know the secret behind this position commitment."

fields.name: position_commitment
docs: Commitment binding the prover to a specific position

types.name: InitPositionOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: MXEAccount
docs: A MPC Execution Environment.

types.name: MetaKeysVault
docs: Optional: Meta Keys Vault for MPC Storage
If using Arcium MPC to store meta-keys securely on-chain,
this account stores the encrypted keys.
Seeds: [b"meta_keys_vault", owner.key()]

fields.name: owner
docs: Owner of this vault

fields.name: ciphertexts
docs: Encrypted ciphertexts: [spend_lo, spend_hi, view_lo, view_hi]
Each 32-byte key is split into two u128 values for MPC

fields.name: nonce
docs: Encryption nonce

fields.name: is_initialized
docs: Whether vault is initialized

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: MxeStatus
docs: The status of an MXE.

types.name: NodeMetadata
docs: location as [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code

types.name: NodeRef
docs: A reference to a node in the cluster.
The offset is to derive the Node Account.
The current_total_rewards is the total rewards the node has received so far in the current
epoch.

types.name: NullifierRecord
docs: Record that a nullifier has been used, preventing double-claims.
Uses init constraint - existence means used. Second init with same seeds fails.
Seeds: [b"nullifier", organization.key(), nullifier]

fields.name: nullifier
docs: The nullifier value

fields.name: position
docs: The position this nullifier was used for

fields.name: used_at
docs: Timestamp when nullifier was consumed

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: Organization
docs: Organization account that manages vesting schedules and positions.
Seeds: [b"organization", admin.key()]

fields.name: admin
docs: Admin public key who can manage this organization

fields.name: name_hash
docs: Hash of the organization name for privacy

fields.name: schedule_count
docs: Number of vesting schedules created

fields.name: position_count
docs: Number of vesting positions created (regular Solana accounts)

fields.name: compressed_position_count
docs: Number of compressed vesting positions (Light Protocol)

fields.name: treasury
docs: Treasury account for token storage

fields.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint for vesting payments

fields.name: is_active
docs: Whether the organization is active

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: Output
docs: An output of a computation.
We currently don't support encrypted outputs yet since encrypted values are passed via
data objects.

types.name: Parameter
docs: A parameter of a computation.
We differentiate between plaintext and encrypted parameters and data objects.
Plaintext parameters are directly provided as their value.
Encrypted parameters are provided as an offchain reference to the data.
Data objects are provided as a reference to the data object account.

types.name: ProcessClaimV2Output
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: ProofRecord
docs: Record that a proof has been verified on-chain.
This serves as an attestation that can be referenced by other instructions
(e.g., the claim flow can check for a valid ProofRecord before releasing funds).
PDA Seeds: [b"proof_record", verifier.key(), nullifier]
Using the nullifier ensures each proof can only create one record.

fields.name: verifier
docs: The account that submitted and paid for verification

fields.name: circuit_id
docs: Circuit identifier (matches VerificationKeyAccount.circuit_id)

fields.name: nullifier
docs: Nullifier from the proof (for withdrawal/eligibility proofs)
For identity proofs, this is the position_commitment

fields.name: verified_at
docs: Timestamp when the proof was verified

fields.name: is_valid
docs: Whether this record is still valid (can be invalidated by admin if needed)

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: ProofType
docs: Type of ZK proof being verified.
Used in events and for circuit identification.

types.name: SetUnset
docs: Utility struct to store a value that needs to be set by a certain number of participants (keys
in our case). Once all participants have set the value, the value is considered set and we only
store it once.

types.name: StealthMetaAddress
docs: Stealth Meta-Address Registry
Stores an employee's public stealth meta-address (S, V) on-chain.
Employers fetch this to derive one-time stealth addresses for payments.
The employee keeps (s, v) private keys secret and only publishes
the public keys (S = s*G, V = v*G).
Seeds: [b"stealth_meta", owner.key()]

fields.name: owner
docs: Owner who can update this meta-address

fields.name: spend_pubkey
docs: Spend public key (S = s * G) - used to derive stealth addresses

fields.name: view_pubkey
docs: View public key (V = v * G) - used for ECDH shared secret

fields.name: is_active
docs: Whether this meta-address is active

fields.name: registered_at
docs: Timestamp when registered

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: StealthPaymentEvent
docs: Stealth Payment Event
Emitted when a payment is made to a stealth address.
Employees scan these events to discover payments.

fields.name: organization
docs: Organization making the payment

fields.name: stealth_address
docs: The stealth address receiving payment

fields.name: ephemeral_pubkey
docs: Ephemeral public key (R = r * G) - needed for recipient to derive key

fields.name: encrypted_payload
docs: Encrypted payload (contains ephemeral private key for recipient)

fields.name: position_id
docs: Position ID (if associated with a vesting position)

fields.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint

fields.name: timestamp
docs: Timestamp

types.name: StealthWithdrawalEvent
docs: Stealth Withdrawal Event
Emitted when funds are withdrawn from a stealth address.

fields.name: stealth_address
docs: The stealth address that was spent from

fields.name: destination
docs: Destination address (could be another stealth address or regular)

fields.name: amount
docs: Amount withdrawn

fields.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint

fields.name: timestamp
docs: Timestamp

types.name: StoreMetaKeysOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: VerificationKeyAccount
docs: On-chain account storing a Groth16 verification key for a specific Noir circuit.
Each circuit (withdrawal_proof, identity_proof, eligibility) has its own VK
derived from the trusted setup ceremony. The VK is stored on-chain so that
proof verification can reference it without passing it as instruction data.
PDA Seeds: [b"vk", circuit_id]
Where circuit_id is a 32-byte identifier (e.g., SHA-256 of circuit name).

fields.name: authority
docs: Authority that can update or deactivate this VK (typically the DAO admin)

fields.name: circuit_id
docs: Unique identifier for which circuit this VK belongs to.
Derived as: sha256("withdrawal_proof"), sha256("identity_proof"), etc.

fields.name: vk_data
docs: Serialized VerificationKey data (AnchorSerialize format).
Contains alpha_g1, beta_g2, gamma_g2, delta_g2, and IC points.
Variable length due to IC vector.

fields.name: is_active
docs: Whether this VK is active and can be used for verification

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: VestingPosition
docs: Vesting position with encrypted amounts for privacy.
Seeds: [b"vesting_position", organization.key(), position_id.to_le_bytes()]

fields.name: organization
docs: Organization this position belongs to

fields.name: schedule
docs: Vesting schedule used for this position

fields.name: position_id
docs: Unique position identifier within the organization

fields.name: beneficiary_commitment
docs: Commitment hash of beneficiary identity (for privacy)

fields.name: encrypted_total_amount
docs: Encrypted total vesting amount (single ciphertext for u64)

fields.name: encrypted_claimed_amount
docs: Encrypted amount already claimed (single ciphertext for u64)

fields.name: nonce
docs: Nonce for encryption

fields.name: start_timestamp
docs: Start timestamp for vesting

fields.name: is_active
docs: Whether this position is active

fields.name: is_fully_claimed
docs: Whether all tokens have been claimed

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: VestingSchedule
docs: Vesting schedule defining the parameters for a vesting plan.
Seeds: [b"vesting_schedule", organization.key(), schedule_id.to_le_bytes()]

fields.name: organization
docs: Organization this schedule belongs to

fields.name: schedule_id
docs: Unique schedule identifier within the organization

fields.name: cliff_duration
docs: Cliff duration in seconds before vesting begins

fields.name: total_duration
docs: Total vesting duration in seconds

fields.name: vesting_interval
docs: Interval between vesting events in seconds

fields.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint for this schedule

fields.name: is_active
docs: Whether this schedule is active

fields.name: position_count
docs: Number of positions using this schedule (regular Solana accounts)

fields.name: compressed_position_count
docs: Number of compressed positions using this schedule (Light Protocol)

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

types.name: WithdrawalPublicInputs
docs: Public inputs for the withdrawal proof circuit.
Circuit proves: "I know a valid vesting position in state_root, for epoch_id,
with unused nullifier, and I'm entitled to withdraw."

fields.name: state_root
docs: Merkle root of the compressed vesting state tree

fields.name: epoch_id
docs: Current epoch identifier (time-bucketed for privacy)

fields.name: nullifier
docs: Nullifier to prevent double-claiming (hash of secret + position)

fields.name: withdrawal_commitment
docs: Commitment to the withdrawal parameters
